H0.text: How many books in the Bible's Old Testament are included in the Catholic version but not in the Protestant one. 3

H1.text: How many books in the Bible's Old Testament are included in the Catholic version but not in the Protestant one. 10

H2.text: How many books in the Bible's Old Testament are included in the Catholic version but not in the Protestant one. 5

H3.text: How many books in the Bible's Old Testament are included in the Catholic version but not in the Protestant one. 7

A4.text: The Council of Trent (1546) adopted a list of the Old Testament that includes deuterocanonical books such as Tobit, Judith, Esther, Wisdom, Ecclesiasticus, Baruch, and the two books of Maccabees.

A6.text: Luther moved seven Old Testament books (Tobit, Judith, 1â€“2 Maccabees, Book of Wisdom, Sirach, and Baruch) into the Apocrypha, which are not considered equal to the Holy Scriptures but are useful and good to read.
